alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 8:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Middlesex, King and Queen, central New Kent, King William and southeastern Essex Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saint Stephens Church, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... King William around 845 PM EDT. Stevensville around 850 PM EDT. King And Queen Court House around 900 PM EDT. Little Plymouth around 915 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Upright, Ino, Cohoke, Dragonville, Epworth, Rose Garden, Biscoe, Colonial Downs, Crouch and Globe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
